body: Increasing physical activity can help improve sleep, energy level, and mood. What can you do as a first step towards being more active?
While physical activity can seem exhausting at first, being more active can increase energy levels in the long run. What can you do to be active today or tomorrow?
Increasing physical activity can help improve memory, mood, stress level, and sleep. How can you be more active today? Start with something small!
Physical activity can help lower blood pressure and cholesterol, which in turn, can lower your risk for a heart attack or stroke. How can you be more active today?
Physical activity can make your muscles and bones stronger. How can you be more active today to start strengthening your body?
Increasing physical activity can improve balance and flexibility and even help you look younger. Set aside a few minutes today to move around!
Setting and meeting a goal can be a powerful experience! What goal would you like to set for becoming more physically active?

Do you have trouble sticking with an exercise program? If so, the key might be finding the type of physical activity that you enjoy. It's helpful to try out different types of exercise to see which you like the most!
Moving in small ways each day can make a big difference over time in terms of increasing level of activity! How can you work in a small walk today to reduce sitting time and get in a few extra steps?

There are so many ways to be active! How about trying one today? Here are some ideas: walking while on the phone, dancing to music, playing with your kids or pets, standing up and moving around during TV commercials, or taking a short walk after a meal.

Bad weather can interfere with physical activity, especially when it is very hot or very cold. What kind of back-up plan can you create for engaging in physical activity even when the weather isn't perfect? Why not try an indoor activity?

Instead of completing all of your physical activity at once, you can also break it up into smaller chunks throughout the day. Try breaking up your activity into smaller, more manageable pieces either today or tomorrow!

An important aspect of maintaining physical activity is being safe and knowing your limits. It's always a good idea to slow down or stop if you feel very tired, sick, faint, or pain (including chest pain).

Doing different types of exercises on different days rather than repeating the same type of activity all the time can be helpful for a variety of reasons. Not only can it help increase interest and motivation, but it can also prevent over-use strains or injuries to certain parts of your body!
Engaging in new types of physical activity can improve mood and physical functioning. However, to prevent injurities, make sure you start small and focus on slow, gradual progress!

Finding time to exercise throughout the day can be difficult. Try being creative today and look for small opportunities like taking a short walk at work in between meetings, taking the stairs instead of the elevator, or parking a little farther away!
Some types of exercise can be expensive, but there are also many free activities that you can try like walking or classes at a community center in your area!

There are so many different types of physical activity you can try - walking, biking, swimming, yoga, hiking, Tai Chi, tennis, group fitness classes, gardening, weight lifting, and more. Try something new today to find what activity you enjoy the most!
Physical activity can benefit you in many more ways than just promoting weight loss. In can improve sleep, mood, balance, stress level, energy, and alertness!

Try the "talk test" to see if you are being active at a moderate pace. If you can carry on a conversation with a friend while you are performing the activity without difficulty, you are at a moderate pace!
Tracking your physical activity can motivate you to do more! Try using a watch, clock, timer, fitness tracker, or phone app to track how much you move today.
Keeping track of your physical activity can be very helpful. Try using a notebook, spreadsheet, smartphone app, or whatever works for you. And don't worry if you miss days; just try your best!

Keeping track of your physical activity every day can be very helpful in maintaining your routine. Try finding a method of tracking and a particular time of day to make a note of what exercise you did throughout the day that works for you!
Sometimes, tracking physical activity in a way that is easy to see, like on a calendar or hanging a tracking sheet on your fridge, can give you extra motivation. Try it out today!

It can be difficult to establish a habit of regularly tracking your physical activity. Try using reminders like sticking a post-it-note where you will easily see it or setting an alarm at the end of the day!
Tracking your physical activity is one of the best ways to maintain progress when working towards a goal. What's an easy way of tracking that you can start today and do every day?
Tracking your physical activity does not have to be difficult or time-consuming. What is an easy way of keeping track of your activity every day?

Choosing a healthy diet can seem complicated and overwhelming at time. Try starting with foods that are rich in fiber like vegetables and avoid foods that are high in calories, fat, and sugar content!
Try filling half of your plate with non-starchy vegetables like lettuce, spinach, carrots, peppers, broccoli, or asparagus as much as you can. These foods are low in calories and high in fiber!
To improve your diet, a good rule of thumb is to try to limit grains or starchy foods like bread or potatoes to only a quarter of your plate for each meal.
When choosing a good source of protein, focus on lean proteins such as chicken or fish. There are many healthy and delicious ways to prepare these versatile meats!
Juice and soda often have surprisingly high levels of sugar. When reaching for a beverage, try sticking to water, tea, or coffee (without added sugar) instead!
If you are watching your weight, try eating more delicious low starch, low calorie vegetables like broccoli, carrots, celery, leafy greens, or peppers.
When reaching for a grain or a starchy food, try choosing healthy options such as 100% whole grain bread or tortillas, black beans, brown rice, or green peas!
If you're craving something sweet, try eating a piece of fruit. Apples, apricots, blueberries, strawberries, or oranges can be a sweet and delicious dessert!
Snack foods, candy, cookies, ice cream, and anything made with corn syrup may taste good but are especially unhealthy. Try to eat these treats only on special occasions!
Fried foods like french fries and fried chicken can be so tempting but are not very healthy. Try to limit these foods as much as possible!
If you like dairy products, try choosing small portions of low-fat milk, yogurt, and cheese!
It's a great idea to always have fruits and vegetables on hand. One way to do this on a budget is to keep frozen veggies and fruit in your freezer that you can quickly heat up!
Here are some helpful tips for a successful trip to the grocery store: never shop when you are hungry, buy healthy items in large quantities, and make a list before you go!
Having a collection of recipes for tasty, simple, healthy meals will make it easier to make a healthy diet part of your daily routine. Start your collection today!
A trick to making healthy food taste better is to add herbs and spices. What are your favorite herbs and spices that can make low-calorie meals more satisfying?
Having supportive family and friends who will shop, cook, and eat healthy foods with you can help you stay on track. Reach out to someone and share recipes today!
If you'd like to lose weight, a good way to start is cutting 500 calories per day. What high-calorie foods can you eat less of this week?
Foods high in fiber can help you feel full for longer periods of time, which can help reduce snacking and over-eating. Vegetables and fruits are high in fiber; try eating more today!
Tracking what you eat can help you identify ways that you can improve your diet. Try keeping a food journal for a week and see if it motivates you to be more healthy!
Try at least one new healthy food this week to find what you like the most. There are so many vegetables, fruits, and healthy grains to choose from!
A healthy meal includes a wide variety of colors, textures, and tastes. Try eating a healthy meal tonight that is colorful and complex!
Set aside one night per week to have a healthy meal. Try a healthy ethnic dish, soup, or vegetarian option!
Delete - not relevant (diabetes)

The best way to stay motivated to make a change is to develop a realistic plan for improvement and measure and track your progress! Try writing down a specific, realistic plan for improving your diet today!

The best way to stay motivated to make a chance is to develop a realistic plan for improvement and measure and track your progress! Try writing down a specific, realistic plan for increasing physical activity today!
A great way to help you stay motivated is to recognize the small successes you make on the way to improving your diet and reward yourself!
A great way to help you stay motivated is to recognize the small successes you make on the way to meeting your physical activity goal and reward yourself!
Think about all the progress you've already made in improving your diet and how much closer you are now to reaching your ultimate goals!
Think about all the progress you've already made in increasing physical activity and how much closer you are now to reaching your ultimate goals!
Tracking your progress towards improving your diet and recognizing your successes along the way can help remind you of your goals and help keep you motivated!
Tracking your progress towards increasing your physical activity and recognizing your successes along the way can help remind you of your goals and help keep you motivated!
Working towards increasing your physical activity with a friend or family member can help keep you both motivated and on track through some friendly competition!
Working towards a healthier diet with a friend or family member can help keep you both motivated and on track through some friendly competition!
Family and friends can give you support and encouragement to keep you motivated. Who can you reach out to today for support in meeting your goal for a healthier diet?
Family and friends can give you support and encouragement to keep you motivated. Who can you reach out to today for support in meeting your physical activity goal?

Going out to dinner can make it difficult to choose healthy food options. Try to look at menus online ahead of time to choose restaurants that have nutritious dishes lower in calories, sugar, and fat!
Next time you go out to eat, consider swapping out french fries or chips for a vegetable side dish like a salad or steamed broccoli!

Restaurants often serve large portions. Try ordering an appetizer instead or splitting an entrée with a friend! Apps like MyFitnessPal can help you figure out approximate calories in your meal and track your daily caloric intake.

When eating at a restaurant, don't be afraid to ask the waiter how a meal is prepared including what kind of oil is used or what ingredients may be in the meal that are not listed in the menu. Knowing more about the food can help you make healthy choices!
A way to avoid eating too much at social gatherings or when you go out to eat with friends is to have a healthy snack beforehand so you aren't so hungry!

It might feel overwhelming to choose healthy options from a restaurant menu. Keeping your eye out for words like "broiled," "low-fat," "steamed," or "baked" can help you identify the healthier dishes.
A helpful tip for preventing over-eating is to drink water frequently, both before and during a meal. Drinking more water can help you stay hydrated and also helps you feel full!
A heart-healthy diet involves foods that are low in calories, salt, and fat and high in fiber. What are some healthy choices you can make today?
Sitting for long periods of time can be detrimental to heart health. Try standing up every half hour and moving around for two minutes!
The mind-body connection is a strong one. Stress is not only harmful for your mind but also harmful for your heart. If you are feeling stressed, try pausing and taking several deep breaths.
Believe it or not, a small amount of healthy fat can be good for your heart! Foods like avocado, nuts, or olive oil are low in saturated and trans fats and are healthy choices to eat in moderation.
Skin and fat on meats are high in cholesterol, which can be detrimental to your heart health. When eating meat, consider removing the skin and cutting away the fat for a more heart-healthy meal!
High-fat dairy products can contain high levels of cholesterol. For a heart healthy option, try low- or non-fat dairy products instead!
Stress is bad for both your mind and your body. Have you been feeling stressed lately? Try confiding in a friend or family member about what's on your mind.

Have you been feeling stressed lately? Try this fun technique to relax: tense your forearms for five seconds and then release the tension for ten seconds. Repeat this with other areas of your body until you feel more calm.
Have you been feeling stressed lately? Try taking deep breaths and counting slowly to 20 in your head. If that doesn't help, try confiding in a friend or family member about what's on your mind.
Do specific events stress you out? If so, it can be helpful to develop a plan for how to relax before, during, and after the event. Try taking deep breaths or sharing your feelings with a friend!
Physical activity and a healthy diet can help control many risk factors for heart disease. Take a walk today and add some colorful vegetables to your meals!
If you are over the age of 40, you should have your cholesterol levels checked every year to help maintain heart health. Schedule an appointment with your doctor today if you don't already have one!
If you are under the age of 40, you should have your cholesterol levels checked every five years to maintain heart health. Make sure you know the recommended levels for LDL/HDL and triglycerides!

The American Heart Association has identified the following as risk factors for heart disease: smoking, physical inactivity, high cholesterol, high blood pressure, diabetes, obesity, stress, alcohol consumption, and poor diet. Are any of these factors something you would like to change?
Being physically active and having a healthy diet can reduce your risk for heart disease. A heart-healthy lifestyle is your best defense against heart disease!
High blood pressure increases the risk for developing both health disease and kidney failure. Be sure to have regular appointments with your doctor, exercise consistently, and eat healthy foods!
To prevent or manage heart disease, you should exercise for at least 30 minutes 5 days per week. What can you do today to be active?
To prevent or manage heart disease, eat healthy high-fiber foods that are low in cholesterol, trans fats, and saturated fats. Try to eat less than 300mg of cholesterol every day!
To prevent or manage heart disease, try eating vegetables, fruits, and fiber-rich whole-grain foods, and limit how much sodium you eat. Try adding in two 3.5 oz servings of fish per week as well!
To make the most out of your next trip to the grocery store, make a list ahead of time and stick to it. Make sure you include some healthy snacks!
Looking through local grocery fliers to find what items are on sale is a good way to save time and money the next time you go to the grocery store.
Cooking healthy meals can seem time-consuming and complicated at times. Cutting up your veggies ahead of time and saving leftovers for future meals are great ways to save time!
A healthy meal is made up of 50% non-starchy vegetables and fruits, 25% grains, and 25% lean protein (for example, chicken or fish). Fill your grocery cart with these foods!
It may not be realistic to eliminate desserts and sweets completely from your diet. Just remember, indulge in moderation!
Thinking about healthy ways to prepare food for dinner? Try grilling, steaming, or baking meats and veggies to minimize unhealthy fats.
Try to avoid sodas and fruit drinks that are high in sugar and calories. Water is always the healthiest and cheapest option!

Making changes can be difficult. Consider joining a support group with others trying to be more physically active. It's a great way to encourage yourself and others to stay on the path towards a healthy lifestyle!
If you have trouble staying on track, consider writing down your physical activity goals and sharing them with your friends and family. They can cheer you on and hold you accountable!
If you have trouble staying on track, consider writing down your goals for improving your diet and sharing them with your friends and family. They can cheer you on and hold you accountable!
If you're looking for more support, try joining a new fitness club. You might meet other people with similar goals for increasing physical activity who can work with you and encourage you!

Consider speaking with a professional in your community with specialized training in promoting healthy behaviors. You can learn new tips for increasing physical activity and receive extra support in working towards your goals!

Consider speaking with a professional in your community with specialized training in promoting healthy behaviors. You can learn new tips for improving your diet and receive extra support in working towards your goals!
Sometimes negative friends, family members, or coworkers can discourage you from increasing your level of physical activity. Don't let them drag you down; you are in control of the choices you make!
Sometimes negative friends, family members, or coworkers can discourage you from eating healthier foods. Don't let them drag you down; you are in control of the choices you make!
Invite your friends to make healthier choices with you. Having extra support can make it easier to stay focused and on track when trying to be more active!

Support groups can be helpful in connecting you with people who are also trying to make healthier choices like increasing your level of physical activity. You can also receive help with healthcare, transportation, and finances as well!

Support groups can be helpful in connecting you with people who are also trying to make healthier choices like eating healthier foods. You can also receive help with healthcare, transportation, and finances as well!
The food you eat and the beverages you drink all contain calories. Your body burns these calories when you are active. The goal is to balance the calories you take in with the ones you burn!
It can be helpful to track your calories throughout the day. Set a realistic goal for yourself and try not to go over it!
If you are interested in cutting calories, try substituting water or skim milk for a sugary, high-calorie beverage. You might be surprised how many calories this saves you!

There are easy ways to burn calories that don't require major changes to your daily schedule. Try climbing a hill, walking out of your way to get extra steps, or walking faster than you normally would!
When snacking in front of the TV, it's easy to lose track of how much you eat. Try using a small bowl or dish to set aside a reasonable portion before you sit down to prevent over-eating!

We can spend a lot of time during the day sitting, whether it be for work or for pleasure. Between meetings or commercial breaks, try to do an active activity like walking in place or doing some jumping jacks!
If you're hungry when you go to the grocery store, you're more likely to choose comfort foods over healthy items. Try having a small snack before you leave so you can make better, healthier choices!

Sometimes when we're bored, our bodies can mistake that feeling for hunger. If this is a problem for you, try talking a walk or chatting with a friend instead. If the hunger persists, try a small healthy snack!
Healthy habits can feel like a chore, especially if you're trying to fit them into an already busy schedule. Set aside small portions of baby carrots or trail mix that you can easily grab on the go!
You might be surprised to learn how unhealthy some beverages can be. Next time you're thirsty, try water, unsweetened tea, or another low-sugar option instead of soda or beer.

Changing your diet can be really difficult! If you find yourself struggling, try to identify possible triggers for unhealthy habits (e.g., eating more when you are bored). Once you've identified these triggers, brainstorm how you can avoid them!

Increasing physical activity can be very difficult, especially if you struggle with pain or fatigue. Start with a low-impact exercise like walking with a friend or doing yoga instead of a vigorous high-impact activity like running.

Casual snacking can be unhealthy when we lose track of the amount of food we are eating. Instead of snacking at the same time as you are working or watching TV, try to eat a healthy snack when you are not distracted and can be more conscious about your portion control.

Sometimes the foods we love the most are detrimental to our health. If you have a favorite dish that has unheatlhy ingredients, try exploring what healthier ingredients you can use as substitutes rather than avoiding the dish altogether!

Coping with stress can be very difficult. Sometimes, we tend to use food to try to improve our mood. If you know you do this, make sure you have healthy choices on hand like fruits and vegetables and explore other ways to reduce stress!

It can be hard to stick to a healthy diet if your friends or family members are not doing the same. Try letting your friends and family members know about your health eating goals and encourage them to eat healthy with you!

Negative thoughts can be a barrier to positive change in your life. When you're feeling down, try to identify negative thoughts and conciously replace them with encouragements or positive thoughts. Slowly, you'll get in the habit of positivity!

When setting goals, remember that it can be easy to make excuses and slide back into old habits. If you plan to go for a walk three days this week, but it rains every day, have an alternative plan like using a treadmill or walking around an indoor mall.

When making changes to your diet, it can be easy to become frustrated if you assume that you can never enjoy your favorite foods again. Try to avoid this kind of black-or-white thinking and remember that almost any food is ok for you in moderation!

It's natural to try to compare yourself to others, but this is not always helpful. If you're feeling discouraged about your health compared to those around you, just focus on the many positive changes you've already made in your life!
Tracking what you eat every day is a great way to be more aware of your diet. Try keeping a food diary so you can see where you are doing well and where you can make improvements.

Tracking what you eat every day is a great way to be more aware of your diet. If you like using phone apps, try MyFitnessPal or other similar apps that allow you to track your daily calories in an easy and quick way!

Food packaging often has a lot of helpful information. First, look at the serving size; often, one serving is only a portion of the package and not the whole thing. Next, focus on the calories and carbohydrates per serving and note these in your food diary!

It is always helpful to check the nutrition label on snacks and meals. While high amounts of fiber, protein, and vitamins are beneficial, you want to make sure that you are limiting your intake of carbohydrates, fat, and sodium.

Keeping track of your food can feel like a time-consuming chore with your busy schedule. Try keeping a piece of paper or a phone app on hand to make tracking faster after each meal. Alternatively, you can take a picture of your meal before you eat so you can record it later!

Keeping track of your food can feel like a time-consuming chore, especially when you have to make note of your food several times per day. Try setting reminders on your phone or watch; soon, it will just feel like a normal part of your regular routine!

Getting started with a new exercise routine can feel really intimindating! Try starting with short, low-intensity exercises such as taking a walk around the block. Then, work up gradually in intensity as you feel yourself getting stronger!

Setting goals can be really helpful in establishing a new routine. Try setting exercise goals for yourself based on your own personal fitness level. Your goals should be challenging yet realistic so you don't get discouraged!
You don't need fancy machines or weights to build your muscles. Try strength training with body weight exercises like squats, push-ups, or lunges in the comfort of your own home!

Fitting exercise into your busy day can be a challenge! There are often simple changes that you can try that will make a big difference. For example, try waking up just 30 minutes earlier or leaving a few minutes after dinner to fit in a walk.

A simple way to add exercise into your schedule is to walk or bike places instead of driving. If it's possible, try walking or biking to work or when doing errands to increase your daily physical activity!

Most of us spend more time analyzing bad events rather than savoring and appreciating positive events. Focusing on the positive is a skill that takes time and practice. Try to reflect on three positive moments from your day today!

Even during difficult times, it is often possible to recognize positive moments. Recognize and face your challenges today with determination but also try to note and appreciate the small, positive moments along the way!

Take time today to reflect on one positive thing that has happened and think about how it made you feel. If you write it down, you may experience an even bigger boost of joy from the simple act of recording it!
People often remember negative events more easily than positive events. Today, try to balance this out by purposefully focusing more on the good parts of your day rather than the negative parts!

Focusing on bad events can help us learn from them and avoid similar situations in the future. However, don't forget to savor and appreciate the good events as well so you can have more of them in the future!

It is common to spend more time focusing on our shortcomings rather than our strengths. Today, remind yourself of one of your personal strengths and brainstorm a way to use this personal strength in a new way this week!
Having a sense of mastery or expertise over something can feel really good. Today, do something that you are good at to remind yourself of your abilities!
Reflecting on personal strengths can help you realize just how remarkable your abilities are. Today, try using a talent or strength that you haven't thought about in awhile!
Using our unique personal strengths can boost self-esteem, increase energy, reduce stress, and increase feelings of productivity. Use a personal strength today to give youreself a boost of energy!
We often don't give ourselves enough credit for our skills and expertise. Spending more time thinking about your strengths can help you remember to give yourself the credit you deserve!
A personal strength is a quality that feels genuine to who you are as a person. Identify a personal strength and use it today to put yourself back in touch with who you feel you truly are.
Choose and use one of your many personal strengths today! Possibilities include curiosity, love of learning, bravery, persistence, honesty, love, or teamwork.
Choose and use one of your many personal strengths today! Possibilities include fairness, leadership, humility, self-control, appreciation of beauty and excellence, humor, or spirituality.
The more you can use your personal strengths in new or different ways, the greater the boost of happiness or confidence you might get in return!
Research shows that life satisfaction depends less on actual events and more on what we choose to pay attention to. Write down three things that you are grateful for today!
Writing a short thank you note to express your gratitude for another person's kindness can help remind you of how good people can be. Try it today!
Think back over the last several years and recall an instance when someone did something for you for which you are grateful. Consider writing a note or calling them to thank them today!
Think of someone who has been especially kind to you but who has never heard you fully express your gratitude. Consider thanking them today with an email or phone call!
When something good happens today, try to capitalize on it by sharing what happened with loved ones, recording the event, or celebrating it in some way!
Celebrations don't have to be reserved only for major events. Try to celebrate something small today for which are grateful and see if it boosts your mood!
You can boost the enjoyment of something positive today by sharing what happened with a friend or a loved one. Sharing your joy can magnify it!

Today, reflect on a past success. Think about how it felt to achieve your success and how you played a role in making it happen. Remembering past successes can boost confidence and motivate you to achieve more!
Remembering past successes is not always easy. Try reminding yourself of your capabilities and strenghts by visualizing a past success today!
Recalling a past success and identifying how you contribued to the achievement can help you understand how you can succeed again in the future. What past success can you use to motivate you today?

Our personal strengths, past successes, and accomplishments are important aspects of our identity and our lives. Reflecting on these can boost mood and show us how we can achieve more success in the future!

A past success can be large or small, public or private. Think of a success you've had in the past and the skills and qualities you used to make it happen. You can use these skills and qualities again to make a difference in your life!
Today, think of a past success. How did you achieve it? How did it feel when you accomplished it? Most importantly, how can you use your strengths and skills again to achieve more success?

Thinking of a past success can remind you that you have the skills to be successful again in the future. Take a moment today to remember something you have accomplished and how that experience can help you achieven more!
Research has shown that variety and novelty (newness) are important for leading a satisfying life. Today, do something totally new or try making an old activity new and interesting!
Try to have a good mix of enjoyable and meaningful activities in your life. Can you do something that's either fun or meaningful today? What might you need more of today, enjoyment or meaning?
A great way to boost your mood is to engage in fun or meaningful activities. What can you do? Schedule in an activity on your calender for later today or this week if you can!
Enjoyable activities can be done both alone and with others. If you've been doing more activities alone lately, try to do something fun with someone else today and vice versa!
Sometimes doing an enjoyable or meaningful activity on your own can help you feel more energized and motivated. Today, try to do something alone that you love or something that brings you peace!

Doing an enjoyable or meaningful activity with others can help you feel more connected and foster joy for multiple people at the same time. Try to schedule something today or tomorrow with friends or loved ones!
Happiness is best found when engaging in enjoyable and meaningful activities. Try to schedule one of each for later this week!
A meaningful activity is one that enhances the sense of meaning and purpose for your life. Can you schedule something meaningful to do today or tomorrow?
One way to bring more joy into your life is to fill your life with the activities that bring you the most happiness. Today, try to do something you love to multiply your joy!
Just thinking about happiness does not always make you happier. Instead, try engaging in something that makes you happy in an active way. What is something that you love that you can do today?

Humor can lighten the mood, help you feel relaxed, and relieve stress by distracting you from your worries. Try to look at something in your life today with humor and see if you feel any positive benefits!
Humor can bring joy and enrich our lives. Having a sense of humor can also help us cope with life's challenges and make the best of situations. How can you use humor to bring joy to your life today?
Laughter is contagious and can strengthen our social connections. What makes you laugh? How can you bring more humor to yourself and your loved ones today?

Humor can bring joy and enrich our lives, but it does not always have to be so obvious that it makes us laugh out loud. Anything strange or amusing or anything that makes you smile can bring positive benefits. Look for a little humor in your life today!
If used correctly, humor can help you cope with stress. A smile or laugh can improve your mood and may even boost your physical health!
Being able to find humor during difficult times is a hard thing to do but can be a good way to manage stress. If you are able to see the humor, it may also boost your mood and motivation.
Sometimes it is true that "laughter is the best medicine." Write yourself a prescription for humor to get through both the good times and the bad!
Today, try to identify the humorous side of something that happens. Whether you laugh, smile, or are simply mindful of the humor in life, it might help you get through the day!
Being kind and generous can lead you to see others in a more positive light and can foster a sense of community. Do one small act of kindness for another person today and see how it feels!
Doing kind acts can help you appreciate your own good fortune. Try to do something nice for someone today and see how it feels!
Being kind to someone else can be a welcome distraction from your own troubles and can put things in perspective. Try to do something kind for a friend or stranger today!

A major benefit of being kind to others is that it can boost your self-esteem and change how you see yourself. Do something kind for someone else today, and you might just get a boost of positivity in return!
When you are kind to others, you may begin to view yourself as a person who is kind and caring. Try to do one small act of kindness today!
Studies find that helping others or volunteering for a good cause can help people better understand their own abilities, resources, and expertise. Try to help someone today, even in a small way!
When people help others, they often feel that they have greater control over their own lives. Try to do something kind today for someone else and see how it feels!

Doing something kind for someone else can help restore your energy after a difficult situation or help you replace negative thoughts with more positive ones. Try doing something kind for someone today!
You may already do kind things for other people on a regular basis. If so, today, try to do something kind for someone in a way that you've never tried before!
Take a moment today to reflect on a kind act you have done for someone else in the past. Now, try to think of a small kind act you can do for another person in the future!

Performing an act of kindness for someone else can bring you feelings of joy or satisfaction. Try to do something kind for someone today. Don't worry about whether they will appreciate it; just enjoy yourself!
As an act of kindness, give someone a genuine compliment today. See how it feels to let a person know that you value his/her good qualities!

During difficult times, it is natural to think that you would be happier if only the circumstances changed. Today, if you find yourself in a difficult spot and you can't change the circumstances, try to change your attitude and think more positive thoughts!

Performing intentional activities to promote happiness can be powerful, regardless of what challenges are present in your life. Schedule an activity today that can bring you joy or a greater sense of meaning!

Experiencing more positive emotions is a lot like learning a new expertise; it takes daily and deliberate practice to cultivate the right skills. Observe one positive emotion today and determine what caused it so you can experience it again!

Being happier can help people to engage in healthier behaviors such as being physically active or eating healthier foods. Think of something that makes you happy and use it as fuel to improve your life!
Today, if you notice yourself having frequest negative thoughts, try to turn your mind back to the present moment and focus on the positive instead.

Engaging in activities that are out of the ordinary can be fulfilling and boost positive emotions. Try a new enjoyable activity or pick a new way to be kind to someone else today and see how you feel!
If you plan the positive activities you will do ahead of time, you will feel positive in anticipation of the activity, during the activity, and afterwards! What can you plan for today?

There are many positive feelings other than just "good" or "happy." The better you can become at describing exactly what positive emotion you are feeling (e.g., joy, inspiration, etc.), the more you can realize how bountiful they are!

Here are 12 common positive emotions: gratitude, love, hope, determination, acceptance, pride, relief, serenity, interest, connectedness, inspiration, and joy. How can you cultivate one of these feelings?
Research suggests that up to 50% of your happiness is under your own control. Today, purposefully do an activity that brings you well-being or joy!
Research has shown that physical activity is a great way to improve your mood. Try exercising today and notice how you feel afterwards!
A regular exercise routine can boost your overall energy levels. What can you do today to be physically active?
Regular exercise can improve your immune system and make it less likely that you will get sick. Try to boost your physical health with some kind of physical activity today!
Exercise can improve focus and make the brain work better. How can you be active today to improve both your body and your mind?
Did you know that exercise can help you grow new brain cells and improve your memory? Add in more exercise to your routine and see if your mind feels sharper!
Exercise, even walking, can help keep your muscles strong and your body healthy. What can you do today to be active and keep your muscles strong?
Our muscles can lose strength rapidly when we don't use them. Regular exercise can prevent this and keep your muscles strong and healthy!
Exercise can improve circulation so that you will have better blood flow to your whole body. Can you take a walk today to get your blood flowing?
The heart is a big muscle, and like all muscles, it needs exercise to stay strong. Take a walk today to keep your hearth strong and healthy!
If losing weight is one of your goals, remember that one of the best ways to control weight is to take a walk or exercise in some other way every day. What can you do to be active today?
People who exercise more live longer. It's never too late to start being active! Do you want to take a walk today and set a goal to make it a habit?
Despite knowing that exercise has many benefits, it can be hard to get motivated to be active every day. Can you think of one way to be more active today?

You are more likely to stick with an exercise routine if you enjoy the type of activity you are doing. It's always helpful to try many different types of physical activity to see what you like the most!
How important is physical activity to you? What motivates you to be more physically active? Can you think of a reason to be active today?

Knowledge is power! By tracking your physical activity, you can learn more about what motivates you or what makes it less likely that you will be active on any given day. Try tracking your activity today!
Pedometers, step-counters, smartwatches, and even phones can help you measure and track your physical activity goals. Can you use one of these today to see how many steps you take?
Developing a system to track your physical activity can make it easier to establish an exercise routine. How can you start tracking today?
Sometimes we don’t realize how much time we spend sitting without moving our bodies very much. Track your physical activity today so you can be aware of how much you move throughout the day!

The more specific and measurable you can make your physical activity goals, the better chance you have of knowing whether you have met your goal! Is your physical activity goal specific and measurable?
In the long run, it is best to have goals that are attainable and realistic. Is your physical activity goal one that you could sustain? If not, think about changing it!
Have you noticed whether anything makes it easier for you to exercise? Is it a friend, a certain song, or a specifc routine? Whatever it is, write it down and try to use it for motivation today!
What makes it more difficult for you to exercise? Is it weather, a bad mood, fatigue? Try brainstorming what your barriers are and writing down ways to problem-solve around them!
Is there a safe place nearby where you could walk or exercise? Try thinking of a spot where you don't normally go and explore a new part of your neighborhood today.
Adding variety into your routine is good for both the mind and the body. Why not try taking a walk along a different route today?
Local parks, walking trails, or even indoor malls can be great places to take a walk. Try finding a new place to walk today!

Sometimes it's easier to stick with your exercise goals if you share them with a friend or family member who can help keep you on track. Can you tell someone you care about today about your physical activity goals?
Some people find that physical activity is more enjoyable when it is done with others. Try finding a friend or family member who can exercise with you this week!
Many cities and towns have community centers, classes, gyms, and other resources for physical activity. This week, try looking into what resources you have in your community!

Setbacks and slips are a normal part of progress. What matters most is not giving up after a setback. Think of a time when you persevered through a setback and use that to motivate you today to meet your physical activity goal!

Today, think of one way that you can make yourself less likely to experience setbacks with your physical activity goals in the future. Write it down and remember not to be hard on yourself if you do slip up; it happens to all of us!
Sitting for several hours during the day can lead to reduced strength and energy over time. Today, try to get up every 30 minutes to move around!
Reducing sitting or sedentary time can improve your energy level, help with pain and body aches, and reduce your risk of disease. Try to get up and move every half an hour today!
Today, try to use a reminder system like a watch or phone alarm to help you remember to get up, stretch, and move every 30 to 60 minutes!
Sitting for prolonged periods of time can be bad for your heart and body. Try to find ways to get up and stretch often today!
Today, think of three pros and three cons of having physical activity as a part of your daily routine. Do you want to exercise regularly? How might you do it?
Did you know that walking for even an additional 15 minutes per day can improve health and well-being? Try to take a walk today either alone or with a friend!
Today, try to incorporate gratitude into your life. Stop for a few minutes and write down three good things that happened to you this week.
There are easy tricks you can use to increase your activity every day. Try parking farther away in a parking lot or taking the stairs instead of the elevator whenever you can!
Try to perform an act of kindness for someone else today. It can be big or small, but notice what positive thoughts and feelings you have when you do it!
The American Heart Association recommends walking as one of the most effective forms of exercise for achieving heart health. Walk whenever you can; in fact, try to take a walk today!
Today, try to take a few minutes to express your gratitude to someone who has done something kind for you at some point in your life. You can write them a letter, call them, or thank them in person!

People who schedule exercise time on their calendar like they would any other important appointment/task are more likely to stick with a physical activity plan. Can you schedule a time to exercise today, even if it's just a short walk?
Time for a boost of positive thoughts and feelings! Take some time today to think about a successful event in your life and how you personally contributed to that success.

Another simple way to improve your health is to reduce the amount of time you spend sitting down throughout the day. Today, try to be mindful of times when you are sitting for an hour or longer and get up and move around!
At the end of the day today, think of one positive event from today and one positive thing you are looking forward to. You can ask a friend to do this with you, too!
When it comes to physical activity, every little bit counts. How can you take a few extra steps today to increase your activity level and benefit your overall health?
Research shows that having social support can make a big difference in achieving physical activity goals. Try telling a friend or family member today about your exercise goals!
If you can, take some time today to stop and appreciate something positive. It could be an important friendship, a beautiful view, or another person's kind act. See how it feels!

Take some time today to think of a simple plan for how you can be more active. Make sure it is realistic and something you feel you can commit to for the next week (like walking for 20 minutes each day). Write it down and try to follow it for the next 7 days!
Exercise can boost your energy level so that you feel more energetic and motivated in general. What can you do today to exercise your body?
Research suggests that people who exercise more also live longer! It's never too late to start exercising. How about taking a walk today and making it a habit?
Did you know that exercise can help you grow new brain cells and improve your memory? Start exercising today to stay sharp!

You are more likely to stick with a physical activity routine if you enjoy what you are doing. It's helpful to try many different types of activity to find what you like most. You can start this week!
Physical activity is a great way to boost your mood. Try exercising for at least 15 minutes today and see if you feel any improvements in your mood or energy level!
What are some reasons why physical activity may be important to you? Can you think of something that motivates you to be more physically active today?
What are your barriers for physical activity? Can you brainstorm and write down a way to get around these potential barriers this week?
Sometimes social support can help you meet your physical activity goals. Try telling a friend or family member today about your goals and see if they can help you stay on track!
For some people, exercise is more fun when it is done with other people. Try finding an exercise partner this week and see how it feels!

Setbacks are a normal part of progress and improvement. What matters most is that you don't give up! Can you think of a time when you had a setback but did not give up? Use this memory as motivation to meet your physical health goals!
Sitting for long periods of time can lead to reduced strength and energy. Today, try to stand up every 30 minutes and move around!
People often focus on negative events rather than the good, positive things that happen. Today, try to notice three good things to promote gratitude and optimism!

Research indicates that life satisfaction depends less on actual events and more on what we choose to pay attention to. Today, try to focus on the positive and write down three things for which you feel gratitude!
Think back over the last several years and remember an instance when someone did something nice for you. Consider writing or calling them to express your gratitude today!

Today, think about a success you have had in your life and spend time savoring how it felt to achieve this success and how you played a role in making it happen. See if you can use this experience to build your confidence and motivation going forward!

Tracking your physical activity can be very motivating and helpful for achieving your goals. Consider using a calendar to mark off the days you are active and record how many minutes you spent being active!
One way to stay more focused on the positive aspects of your life is to use a calendar to write down one thing you are grateful for each day. Try this out today!
Scientific research suggests that performing small acts of kindness can improve your mood and how you think about yourself. Think about what you can do today to be kind to someone else!
Is there someone in your life who motivates you to be healthier? Can you spend time with them or reach out to them today?

It is often easier to add new healthy foods into your diet rather than cutting out the unhealthy foods all at once. Today, try to add some healthy foods into your meals like a large serving of vegetables!
Soda and fruit juice can contain a great deal of sugar and can actually make you feel more tired rather than energized. Instead, try to find a healthier replacement today like water, coffee, or tea!
A great way to eat healthy is to eat foods that are fresh and natural, like vegetables, fruits, nuts, beans, or fish. Is there a healthy, natural food you would like to eat today?
Vegetables are the healthiest food group by far. Try to eat some vegetables with each meal today if you can!
The hungrier we are when choosing food, the harder it can be to choose a healthy option. If you can, try to plan your meals ahead of time when you aren't feeling hungry!
Stress can have a harmful effect on your physical health over time. Today, when you feel worried, try taking deep, slow breaths and focus your attention only on what is within your control to change.
It can be helpful to remember that almost everyone you meet is facing some kind of internal struggle. Today, try to be especially kind and understanding to others…and to yourself!
Making a list of your favorite healthy foods and having them easily available at home can help keep you on track in terms of a healthy diet. Can you make a list of your favorite healthy foods today?
The simplest way to improve your diet is to fill your plate with more vegetables for each meal. Try to increase the amount of vegetables you eat this week by 20%!
Be careful of foods like white bread that are made of simple carbohydrates. Try to use foods rich in complex carbohydrates instead like whole wheat breads, whole grain crackers, or brown rice!
Some fats are actually good for you! Olive oil, soybeans, nuts, or avocados are all examples of healthy fats.
It is a good idea to avoid foods with "partially hydrogenated" oils listed as an ingredient. Partially hydrogenated oils can be found in certain types of synthetic butters or other processed foods!
Fish is generally healthier than red meats like beef. Try to add more fish into your diet for a healthier future!
A good cooking tip is to season foods with herbs and spices instead of salt. Your food will still be tasty but will be much healthier as well!
Today's nutrition tip for a healthy heart: stay away from any foods that contain more than 140mg of sodium (salt) per serving!
Some canned or processed foods can contain high levels of salt. Look for sodium on the nutrition information label and be careful if it says there are more than 140mg of sodium per serving!
Here is a healthy eating tip: try to have fresh fruit for dessert instead of baked goods, puddings, or sweets made with cream or sauces!

It can be difficult to eat healthy foods when ordering from fast food restaurants. This week, try to limit the number of times you eat fast food this week and replace these meals with healthier alternatives!
Some of the best choices for healthy protein include beans, fish, egg whites, tofu/soy, and nuts. Try to have one of these great protein sources this week!
Write down your three favorite vegetables and buy one of them today to snack on during the week!
Physical activity can lower blood pressure and "bad" cholesterol levels and can help you lose weight. Try to find a way to be active today!

It possible, try using positive self-talk to turn negative thoughts into more positive ones. For example, when you catch yourself thinking, "I can't do this," try saying "I'll do the best I can" instead!
To help reduce stress and promote relaxation, try taking 15 to 20 minutes today to sit quietly, relax, breathe deeply in a peaceful environment. Notice how you feel afterward!
Reducing physical tension in your body can help alleviate mental tension as well. Try to walk, bike, do yoga, or exercise in another way to help calm your mind today!
If walking was a medication, doctors would write prescriptions for it all the time! Take a walk today for its many health benefits.
Delete - duplicate
Today, try to reach for healthy foods first when you are hungry instead of indulging in less healthy, comfort foods!
One of the easiest ways to exercise is to start walking on a regular basis. Walking is good for everyone!

To bring yourself a greater sense of calm and motivation today, try quietly meditating or praying for five minutes. It will not take too much time out of your day, and you might notice a major mood change!
What activities make you feel most calm and peaceful? Can you try one of these activities today?
Today, try to practice deep, slow breathing for two minutes while closing your eyes. Do you feel calmer or more at peace afterwards?
To reduce stress, try writing down or thinking about a more positive way to look at something you have been struggling with lately.
It is easy to become stressed out during the day without realizing it. Today, try to take a break from what you are doing for even one minute, close your eyes, and breathe deeply.
Is there a peaceful place near where you live that you could visit today or tomorrow? Purposefully seeking out peace in itself can be calming.
